*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to James F. Perry, March 31, 1828. Concerning family lands in Virginia, New Jersey, and Missouri.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="03-31-1828">March 31. 1828*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr Brother and Sister,*/p*
*p*On my return from the seat of Govt of this *location_mentioned*State */location_mentioned*last winter I found your letter transcribing *person_mentioned*Learning*/person_mentioned*s letter relative to the *location_mentioned*claim in New Jersey*/location_mentioned*, and*person_mentioned* Brother James*/person_mentioned* and myself without delay executed a power of attorney in due form to *person_mentioned*Mr. Learning*/person_mentioned* and sent it direct to him in *location_mentioned*Philadelphia*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*I know nothing of the title deeds for *location_mentioned*land in Virginia*/location_mentioned* that you speak of—I remember having seen two parchment deeds for land in that country in *person_mentioned*father*/person_mentioned*s writing desk about the time he removed to *location_mentioned*Hercuianium*/location_mentioned*—but what became of them or wheither they were for the tracts you allude to I know not. perhaps he took them with him in the desk to *location_mentioned*Little Rock*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Brother */person_mentioned*and myself will give any power of attorney that may be necessary to prosecute our claim to the *location_mentioned*Mine á Burton*/location_mentioned* property but we have not the means to advance money neither can we do it at any short period*/p*
*p*You are doubtless ere this informed by *person_mentioned*Brother*/person_mentioned*s letters of the important change that has taken place in his situation, he was married on the *date_mentioned n="03-20-1828">20 of this month*/date_mentioned* at this place to *person_mentioned*Miss Eliza Martha Westall*/person_mentioned*—he has made a good choice and I think has secured his domestic happiness—we are trying to arrange matters to set him and *person_mentioned*John Austin*/person_mentioned* up in the Mercantile business in which there is a good prospect of success—tho their begining is very small he expects to be in *location_mentioned*Orleans */location_mentioned*in *date_mentioned n="05-xx-1828">May */date_mentioned*or *date_mentioned n="06-xx-1828">June*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I once had a *person_mentioned*sister */person_mentioned*who could spare a few moments every six or eight months to drop a line to her unfortun[ate]? absent, brother— Where is she? has time swept me from her remembrance, or has she too many cares, or too much amusement to allow a half hour to past remembrance—I feel almost cut off from the world, but still something in her own handwriting would be acceptable, how many *person_mentioned*children */person_mentioned*has she, how are they disposed of—what are her future calculations She can tell me a thousand things that will be interesting, for she can write nothing that will be otherwise, It has been more than 18 months since I have recd a line from her own handwriting—I never expect to converse with her otherwise than by letter—time rolls on rapidly, tell her to improve it while she can in chatting once more on paper to her brother-—*/p*
*p*We move on here slowly, but quietly—this *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*will present a *location_mentioned*second Eden*/location_mentioned* to posterity—wheither we shall find it such or not depends on the progress of emigration and improvements—*/p*
*p*Farewell—give my love to all the *person_mentioned*children */person_mentioned*and to all old *person_mentioned*friends*/person_mentioned* and particularly to *person_mentioned*Elias Bates*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*and other *person_mentioned*relations*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubricj*/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Mr. James F. Perry */person_mentioned**location_mentioned*Potosi Washington County State of Missouri*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
